channel.title: Custom Commands help for Delta
channel.description: How can i make my commands work? When i add a command and compile, it doesnt work. Im guessing there is something im missing

item.title: Custom Commands help for Delta
item.dc:creator: @thock321 thock321
item.description:
@thock321 wrote:

My jdk version IS 1.6.0 cuz idk how to get update 26 on my computer. Im using a netbook.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Commands help for Delta
item.dc:creator: @nicke924 nicke924
item.description:
@nicke924 wrote:

[quote=“yo dude 1345, post:10, topic:403244”]Ok this is how you get your java version. First no matter what your operating system is, other then mac and linux. What you do is click on the start button then go to control panel there you should find a program called java, Ok now you must either open it or right click it and goto properties. When you get it to open what ever option you picked you must go to the “java” tab and click view. From there it shows you numbers like this,

Now in your compiler it shows this

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

the “jdk1.6.0” is your jdk update it and you should have the latest jdk of i think either 25 or 26 so it would be

“jdk1.6.0_25” for 25 or, “jdk1.6.0_26” for 26.

once this is done correctly save you compiler and then try to compile. It should work now, =P.[/quote]
Or you go to C:\ or D:\ or whatever it’s named for you and go to your program’s folder and double click Java and then tell us what’s written there.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Commands help for Delta
item.dc:creator: @yo_dude_1345 yo dude 1345
item.description:
@yo_dude_1345 wrote:

Ok this is how you get your java version. First no matter what your operating system is, other then mac and linux. What you do is click on the start button then go to control panel there you should find a program called java, Ok now you must either open it or right click it and goto properties. When you get it to open what ever option you picked you must go to the “java” tab and click view. From there it shows you numbers like this,

Now in your compiler it shows this

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

the “jdk1.6.0” is your jdk update it and you should have the latest jdk of i think either 25 or 26 so it would be

“jdk1.6.0_25” for 25 or, “jdk1.6.0_26” for 26.

once this is done correctly save you compiler and then try to compile. It should work now, =P.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Commands help for Delta

item.description:

Thats the same compiler code…hmm… well the main command i want working is the add model command
[/quote]
It isn’t the same?
Your were only 1.6.0 it should be 1.6.0_urjavaversion[/quote]We first need to find out his JDK version, so we could fix his compiler. His commands come later on.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Commands help for Delta
item.dc:creator: @nicke924 nicke924
item.description:
@nicke924 wrote:

[quote=“thock321, post:4, topic:403244”]Thats the compiler code

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
And its any/every command. Editing an old command for example, and then compiling+running the server. Once i logon and use the command, it doesn’t work. Niether does any new command i add[/quote]

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_YOURJAVAVERSION\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Read full topic

And its any/every command. Editing an old command for example, and then compiling+running the server. Once i logon and use the command, it doesn’t work. Niether does any new command i add

item.title: Custom Commands help for Delta
item.dc:creator: @nicke924 nicke924
item.description:
@nicke924 wrote:

if(command.startsWith(“COMMAND”)) {
addItem(id, amount);
sendMessage(“type your message”);
triggerTele(XCoords+misc.random(2), YCoords+misc.random(2), 0);
}
